block.p: IDT CORP., Newark, an international long distance company, said it planned to buy back as many as 5 million shares, or about 14 percent of its common shares outstanding, currently valued at about $153 million.

INTEL CORP., Santa Clara, Calif., the biggest maker of semiconductors in the world, set a 2-for-1 stock split on July 30 to shareholders of record on July 2. Intel also is raising its dividend to 2 cents, or 33 percent on a post-split basis.

SFX ENTERTAINMENT INC., New York, which produces and presents live entertainment, acquired Core Audience Entertainment, a Canadian concert promoter. Terms were not disclosed.
ARCH COAL INC., St. Louis, the second-largest coal producer in the United States, said it would cut most production at its Coal Creek mine in Wyoming and might idle the site entirely.
